title: Drawing, "Design for Textile-Inventory Card", 1952–69
medium: Red, yellow and blue colored pencil, graphite on white tracing paper drymounted on cardboard
inscribed:
Recto: in graphite upper left: bracket and "1/48" on mount; lower left on drawing: bracket and "repeat"; upper right on mount: "satin" and "rep" with indicators oon design; upper right corner: 7

Verso in graphite upper left corner: II - 36; along right side: 4 motifs in 3 3/8
provenance: This collection was donated to the Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum in 1969 by Alexander Girard
description: Alternating pattern of stripes and circles consisting of five rows of stripes diagonally placed and four rows of circles

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for Textile-Inventory Card", 1952–69.
1952–69. Red, yellow and blue colored pencil, graphite on white tracing paper drymounted on cardboard. Gift of Alexander H. Girard. 1969-165-454.
